Posts.Content: Sep 30, 2010 09:00AM keddamae wrote: I have had the occasional sharp shooting pains all along which the PS said to expect as the nerves are regenerating, this pain is new.  There is a slight thickening above the nipple which I noticed back in August. I pointed it out to the oncologist who didn't seem to think it was anything to worry about.  But that area is where the constant pain is located.  I had a reduction, no reconstruction (went from DD to B).  No changes that I can think of.... I hate to run to the doctor for nothing, but then that little worry is always there poking at you that maybe this is something that needs to be checked out.
Posts.Title: Recurrence of pain 5 months after surgery keddamae katecallahan1

Posts.Content: keddamae wrote: Just wondering if anyone else has breast pain 5 months after surgery.  I had a partial mastectomy on the left and reduction on both sides back in April followed by 5 weeks of radiation.  Everything has healed well and I have only had occasional shooting pains in the nipple area.  But in the past two weeks there has been increasing pain on the cancer side. Starting last night the pain has been constant.  Anyone else experience this???? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Recurrence of pain 5 months after surgery keddamae katecallahan1
